26 #ifndef TILEDARRAY_TILE_OP_ADD_H__INCLUDED

29 #include "../tile_interface/add.h"

36 namespace TiledArray {
37 namespace detail {
38 
40 
52 template <typename Result, typename Left, typename Right, bool LeftConsumable,
53  bool RightConsumable>
54 class Add {
55  public:
56  typedef Add<Result, Left, Right, LeftConsumable, RightConsumable>
57  Add_;
58  typedef Left left_type;
59  typedef Right right_type;
60  typedef Result result_type;
61 
63  static constexpr bool left_is_consumable =
64  LeftConsumable && std::is_same<result_type, left_type>::value;
66  static constexpr bool right_is_consumable =
67  RightConsumable && std::is_same<result_type, right_type>::value;
68 
69  private:
70  // Permuting tile evaluation function
71  // These operations cannot consume the argument tile since this operation
72  // requires temporary storage space.
73 
74  static result_type eval(const left_type& first, const right_type& second,
75  const Permutation& perm) {
76  using TiledArray::add;
77  return add(first, second, perm);
78  }
79 
80  static result_type eval(ZeroTensor, const right_type& second,
81  const Permutation& perm) {
82  TiledArray::Permute<result_type, right_type> permute;
83  return permute(second, perm);
84  }
85 
86  static result_type eval(const left_type& first, ZeroTensor,
87  const Permutation& perm) {
88  TiledArray::Permute<result_type, left_type> permute;
89  return permute(first, perm);
90  }
91 
92  // Non-permuting tile evaluation functions
93  // The compiler will select the correct functions based on the
94  // consumability of the arguments.
95 
96  template <bool LC, bool RC,
97  typename std::enable_if<!(LC || RC)>::type* = nullptr>
98  static result_type eval(const left_type& first, const right_type& second) {
99  using TiledArray::add;
100  return add(first, second);
101  }
102 
103  template <bool LC, bool RC, typename std::enable_if<LC>::type* = nullptr>
104  static result_type eval(left_type& first, const right_type& second) {
105  using TiledArray::add_to;
106  return add_to(first, second);
107  }
108 
109  template <bool LC, bool RC,
110  typename std::enable_if<!LC && RC>::type* = nullptr>
111  static result_type eval(const left_type& first, right_type& second) {
112  using TiledArray::add_to;
113  return add_to(second, first);
114  }
115 
116  template <bool LC, bool RC, typename std::enable_if<!RC>::type* = nullptr>
117  static result_type eval(const ZeroTensor&, const right_type& second) {
118  TiledArray::Clone<result_type, right_type> clone;
119  return clone(second);
120  }
121 
122  template <bool LC, bool RC, typename std::enable_if<RC>::type* = nullptr>
123  static result_type eval(const ZeroTensor&, right_type& second) {
124  return second;
125  }
126 
127  template <bool LC, bool RC, typename std::enable_if<!LC>::type* = nullptr>
128  static result_type eval(const left_type& first, const ZeroTensor&) {
129  TiledArray::Clone<result_type, left_type> clone;
130  return clone(first);
131  }
132 
133  template <bool LC, bool RC, typename std::enable_if<LC>::type* = nullptr>
134  static result_type eval(left_type& first, const ZeroTensor&) {
135  return first;
136  }
137 
138  public:
140 
150  template <typename L, typename R>
151  result_type operator()(L&& left, R&& right, const Permutation& perm) const {
152  return eval(std::forward<L>(left), std::forward<R>(right), perm);
153  }
154 
156 
165  template <typename L, typename R>
166  result_type operator()(L&& left, R&& right) const {
167  return Add_::template eval<left_is_consumable, right_is_consumable>(
168  std::forward<L>(left), std::forward<R>(right));
169  }
170 
172 
180  template <typename R>
181  result_type consume_left(left_type& left, R&& right) const {
182  constexpr bool can_consume_left =
183  is_consumable_tile<left_type>::value &&
184  std::is_same<result_type, left_type>::value;
185  constexpr bool can_consume_right =
186  right_is_consumable && !(std::is_const<R>::value || can_consume_left);
187  return Add_::template eval<can_consume_left, can_consume_right>(
188  left, std::forward<R>(right));
189  }
190 
192 
200  template <typename L>
201  result_type consume_right(L&& left, right_type& right) const {
202  constexpr bool can_consume_right =
203  is_consumable_tile<right_type>::value &&
204  std::is_same<result_type, right_type>::value;
205  constexpr bool can_consume_left =
206  left_is_consumable && !(std::is_const<L>::value || can_consume_right);
207  return Add_::template eval<can_consume_left, can_consume_right>(
208  std::forward<L>(left), right);
209  }
210 
211 }; // class Add
212 
214 
228 template <typename Result, typename Left, typename Right, typename Scalar,
229  bool LeftConsumable, bool RightConsumable>
230 class ScalAdd {
231  public:
232  typedef ScalAdd<Result, Left, Right, Scalar, LeftConsumable,
233  RightConsumable>
234  ScalAdd_;
235  typedef Left left_type;
236  typedef Right right_type;
237  typedef Scalar scalar_type;
238  typedef Result result_type;
239 
241  static constexpr bool left_is_consumable =
242  LeftConsumable && std::is_same<result_type, left_type>::value;
244  static constexpr bool right_is_consumable =
245  RightConsumable && std::is_same<result_type, right_type>::value;
246 
247  private:
248  scalar_type factor_;
249 
250  // Permuting tile evaluation function
251  // These operations cannot consume the argument tile since this operation
252  // requires temporary storage space.
253 
254  result_type eval(const left_type& first, const right_type& second,
255  const Permutation& perm) const {
256  using TiledArray::add;
257  return add(first, second, factor_, perm);
258  }
259 
260  result_type eval(ZeroTensor, const right_type& second,
261  const Permutation& perm) const {
262  using TiledArray::scale;
263  return scale(second, factor_, perm);
264  }
265 
266  result_type eval(const left_type& first, ZeroTensor,
267  const Permutation& perm) const {
268  using TiledArray::scale;
269  return scale(first, factor_, perm);
270  }
271 
272  // Non-permuting tile evaluation functions
273  // The compiler will select the correct functions based on the
274  // consumability of the arguments.
275 
276  template <bool LC, bool RC,
277  typename std::enable_if<!(LC || RC)>::type* = nullptr>
278  result_type eval(const left_type& first, const right_type& second) const {
279  using TiledArray::add;
280  return add(first, second, factor_);
281  }
282 
283  template <bool LC, bool RC, typename std::enable_if<LC>::type* = nullptr>
284  result_type eval(left_type& first, const right_type& second) const {
285  using TiledArray::add_to;
286  return add_to(first, second, factor_);
287  }
288 
289  template <bool LC, bool RC,
290  typename std::enable_if<!LC && RC>::type* = nullptr>
291  result_type eval(const left_type& first, right_type& second) const {
292  using TiledArray::add_to;
293  return add_to(second, first, factor_);
294  }
295 
296  template <bool LC, bool RC, typename std::enable_if<!RC>::type* = nullptr>
297  result_type eval(const ZeroTensor&, const right_type& second) const {
298  using TiledArray::scale;
299  return scale(second, factor_);
300  }
301 
302  template <bool LC, bool RC, typename std::enable_if<RC>::type* = nullptr>
303  result_type eval(const ZeroTensor&, right_type& second) const {
304  using TiledArray::scale_to;
305  return scale_to(second, factor_);
306  }
307 
308  template <bool LC, bool RC, typename std::enable_if<!LC>::type* = nullptr>
309  result_type eval(const left_type& first, const ZeroTensor&) const {
310  using TiledArray::scale;
311  return scale(first, factor_);
312  }
313 
314  template <bool LC, bool RC, typename std::enable_if<LC>::type* = nullptr>
315  result_type eval(left_type& first, const ZeroTensor&) const {
316  using TiledArray::scale_to;
317  return scale_to(first, factor_);
318  }
319 
320  public:
321  // Compiler generated functions
322  ScalAdd(const ScalAdd_&) = default;
323  ScalAdd(ScalAdd_&&) = default;
324  ~ScalAdd() = default;
325  ScalAdd_& operator=(const ScalAdd_&) = default;
326  ScalAdd_& operator=(ScalAdd_&&) = default;
327 
329 
331  explicit ScalAdd(const Scalar factor) : factor_(factor) {}
332 
334 
344  template <typename L, typename R>
345  result_type operator()(L&& left, R&& right, const Permutation& perm) const {
346  return eval(std::forward<L>(left), std::forward<R>(right), perm);
347  }
348 
350 
359  template <typename L, typename R>
360  result_type operator()(L&& left, R&& right) const {
361  return ScalAdd_::template eval<left_is_consumable, right_is_consumable>(
362  std::forward<L>(left), std::forward<R>(right));
363  }
364 
366 
374  template <typename R>
375  result_type consume_left(left_type& left, R&& right) const {
376  constexpr bool can_consume_left =
377  is_consumable_tile<left_type>::value &&
378  std::is_same<result_type, left_type>::value;
379  constexpr bool can_consume_right =
380  right_is_consumable && !(std::is_const<R>::value || can_consume_left);
381  return ScalAdd_::template eval<can_consume_left, can_consume_right>(
382  left, std::forward<R>(right));
383  }
384 
386 
394  template <typename L>
395  result_type consume_right(L&& left, right_type& right) const {
396  constexpr bool can_consume_right =
397  is_consumable_tile<right_type>::value &&
398  std::is_same<result_type, right_type>::value;
399  constexpr bool can_consume_left =
400  left_is_consumable && !(std::is_const<L>::value || can_consume_right);
401  return ScalAdd_::template eval<can_consume_left, can_consume_right>(
402  std::forward<L>(left), right);
403  }
404 
405 }; // class ScalAdd
406 
407 } // namespace detail
408 } // namespace TiledArray
